meanings.sent1: The balloons were all blown up for the party.
meanings.sent2: The candles were blown out by the wind.
meanings.sent3: The blown-up beach ball bounced around the pool.
meanings.sent4: The blown leaves scattered across the yard like confetti.
meanings.sent5: The blown glass vase shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: In a state of being moved or affected by strong winds.
meanings.sent1: The blown trees swayed in the storm.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was blown all over her face in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The blown flag flapped vigorously in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The blown sand stung against their skin at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The blown kite soared high above the park.

meanings.definition: In a state of being destroyed or damaged by an explosion.
meanings.sent1: The blown-up building left a cloud of dust.
meanings.sent2: The blown car was a twisted wreck on the road.
meanings.sent3: The blown tire caused a loud bang on the highway.
meanings.sent4: The blown fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The blown house collapsed in a heap of rubble.

meanings.definition: In a state of being revealed or exposed.
meanings.sent1: Her secret was blown when her diary was found.
meanings.sent2: The scandal was blown wide open by the news.
meanings.sent3: The blown cover story fooled no one.
meanings.sent4: The blown disguise revealed his true identity.
meanings.sent5: The blown conspiracy was finally brought to light.
